DataElement.preferredDefinition: The specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) as captured by the SNOMED CT code.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.:The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.

Property.preferredDefinition: Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PCDC Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description:
1. Go to the SNOMED standalone terminology available via NCI Term Browser at: 
https://ncit.nci.nih.gov/ncitbrowser/pages/vocabulary.jsf?dictionary=SNOMED%20Clinical%20Terms%20US%20Edition&version=2022_09_01
2. Enter your search term in the Search box.
